text: Antigua and Barbuda were first at the Olympic Games in 1976. They have been in each Games since then, missing only the boycotted 1980 Summer Olympics. They have never been in the Winter Olympic Games. The Antigua and Barbuda Olympic Association was formed in 1966 after the end of the West Indies Federation in 1962, and recognized in 1976. == Medal tables == === Medals by Summer Games === Games Athletes Gold Silver Bronze Total Rank 10 0 0 0 0 – did not participate did not participate did not participate did not participate did not participate did not participate 14 0 0 0 0 – 15 0 0 0 0 – 13 0 0 0 0 – 13 0 0 0 0 – 3 0 0 0 0 – 5 0 0 0 0 – 5 0 0 0 0 – 4 0 0 0 0 – 9 0 0 0 0 – future event future event future event future event future event future event Total Total 0 0 0 0 – == Flagbearers == Games Athlete Sport Lester Benjamin Athletics Jocelyn Joseph Athletics Heather Samuel Athletics Heather Samuel Athletics Daniel Bailey Athletics James Grayman Athletics Daniel Bailey Athletics ==References== ==Other websites == * Antigua and Barbuda profile at London2012.com Category:Sport in Antigua and Barbuda Category:Nations at the Olympics
title: Antigua and Barbuda at the Olympics
